item.title: Integrating Novel Treatment Approaches for Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

RME Collaborative Oncology Congress

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Summarize the clinical evidence for the efficacy and safety of new and emerging therapeutic options and treatment strategies for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (CSCC)
  • Develop individualized management plans for advanced and metastatic CSCC, incorporating current guideline recommendations, clinical data, and best practices
  • Implement evidence-based strategies for reducing disparities in CSCC care and treatment in rural and underserved settings

item.title: Novel Approaches to RAS Targeting
item.dc:creator: Ryan J. Sullivan
item.description:
Event

2023 MCGI Forum

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Discussion of novel approaches to targeting RAS

item.title: Integrating the Latest Evidence on Management of Basal Cell Carcinoma
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

RME Collaborative Oncology Congress

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Implement evidence-based strategies for reducing disparities in basal cell carcinoma (BCC) care in rural and underserved settings
  • Differentiate treatment options for BCC based on clinical efficacy and safety data
  • Integrate clinical evidence and current guideline recommendations into treatment plans for patients with BCC
  • Recognize adverse events associated with therapies for BCC to improve adherence to therapy

item.title: Exploring Neoadjuvant Immunotherapies for Surgically Resectable Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
Vishal A. Patel
item.description:
Event

Med Learning Group TeleECHO. Event URL

Overview

In this live program we discuss how neoadjuvant immunotherapy fits into the treatment plan for many patients with surgically resectable cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma.

item.title: Updates in Merkel Cell Carcinoma
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting “Updates in Cutaneous Oncology” Session

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Brief overview of pathophysiology of Merkel cell carcinoma
  • Recognize the use of Imaging and the Merkel cell polyoma virus serum antibody test in clinical practice
  • Discuss recently approved therapeutic strategies in MCC, including the use of Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors as primary treatment, as well as emerging strategies in the neo-adjuvant and adjuvant setting

Presentation Slides

  • To view the slides for this presentation, please click here

item.title: Management of High Risk Uncommon Cutaneous Neoplasms
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting “What’s New in the Management of Advanced Skin Cancer” Session

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Brief overview of pathophysiology of Sebaceous Carcinoma, Dermatofibrosarcoma Protuberans and Merkel cell carcinoma
  • Recognize the use of Imaging and the Merkel cell polyoma virus serum antibody test in clinical practice
  • Discuss recently approved therapeutic strategies in MCC, including the use of Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors as primary treatment, as well as emerging strategies in the neo-adjuvant and adjuvant setting

Presentation Slides

  • To view the slides for this presentation, please click here

item.title: Management of Operable Advanced NMSC
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting “What’s New in the Management of Advanced Skin Cancer” Session

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Review the work up for operable NMSC
    • Discuss the utility of SLNBx & imaging in CSCC
    • Discuss the role of GEP in CSCC
  • Review the management of operable NMSC
    • Discuss the role of CPEMA and adjuvant therapy
    • Discuss the role of pre-operative systemic therapy for NMSC

Presentations Slides

  • To view the slides for this presentation, please click here

item.title: How do we implement systemic therapy to reduce recurrence of high-risk melanomas: from neoadjuvant to adjuvant therapy?
item.dc:creator: David M. Miller
item.description:
Event

American Academy of Dermatology Annual Meeting “Managing Melanoma” Session

Overview & Learning Objectives

  • Review the work up for high-risk melanoma
  • Review the role of pre-operative systemic therapy in melanoma
  • Review the role of post-operative systemic therapy in melanoma
